page.title: 02THE VALE OF EVESHAM
page.content: This particular area of the{Vale of {Evesham}is very fertile with all of the land being cultivated in some form or other. Much of this land , particularly in the{Offenham}area, is intensively cultivated with a lot of it under glass. The whole area consists of the{Bengeworth}part of Evesham, the village of{Badsey}, part of Offenham and the smaller hamlets of {Aldington}and{Blackminster}. Most of the area lies to the East of the{River Avon}before it enters the town of Evesham itself, infact, the Bengeworth part of Evesham is that which lies on the East side of the Avon. A small part of the area concerned does spread to the West side of the Avon also.
